If this doesn't fix it, you might want to also try 

```
return static_cast<unsigned char>(std::tolower(static_cast<int>(c)));
```

since I'm not sure how much `unsigned char` likes to implicitly convert to `int`.

Also, `std::string` uses `std::basic_string<char>`, so I wonder if `unsigned char` should be changed to plain `char`?

But using a lambda with `static_cast`s is exactly what I was going to recommend after reading your Slack post.
